title.narrative: Eclof Colombia - GAP and Financial Education Training

description.narrative: Community Mobilization and awareness raising on the projects.,Train 800 community members in Good Agricultural Practices and Financial Management.,Develop the methdology for the practical and theoretical training.

Since 2012, ECLOF Colombia has been developing a training program administered to small farmers; a total of 850 people have participated in 25 workshops offered, on topics such as Good Agricultural Practice (GAP) and Financial Education (FE). As a result of the GAP training sessions executed so far, farmers have applied what they learned to their farms, greatly improving crop quality. Applying FE learnings has allowed farmers to better manage their household and business finances and mitigate financial risks, enabling them to make the most of their scarce resources for the benefit of their families. This project aims to expand the existing GAP program by including training modules on integrated crop management for the harvest and post-harvest stage, clean cultivation, integrated use of agro chemicals in pest and disease management, integrated management of irrigation and fertilization, secure pesticide application, good farm management, and health precautioning. This will improve the quality of production, conserve water and soil in the Boyacá region, and protect farmers’ health. We will also upgrade and further roll out the financial education training by adding new modules.
